title: Teens injured in shooting
content:
Two teens sustained non-life threatening injuries in a drive-by shooting early Saturday in the 1600 block of South First Street, Springfield police said.
One of the teens was struck in the finger and the second was hit in the thigh. The ages of the juvenile victims weren't available, but police did say they were both males. The shooting occurred about 1 a.m.
Whoever shot the teens was in a dark-colored car with tinted windows.
People with information on this or other crimes can submit tips anonymously by calling Crime Stoppers at 788-8427 or they can submit a tip online at www.cashfortips.us. Tips also can be sent by text. Type TIP672 plus a message and send to CRIMES. Informants are eligible for cash rewards of up to $1,000.
